info.title: SuperDoc API
info.description:
## Quick Start

1 - **Register**: https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/auth/register?email=you@email.com

2 - **Verify**: Check email, then https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/auth/verify?email=you@email.com&code=123456

3 - **Convert**
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/convert?from=docx \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -F "file=@document.docx" \
  -o converted.pdf
```


Or use our Playground:
https://api.superdoc.dev/docs/#tag/documents/post/v1/convert

That's it! Your DOCX is now a PDF.

---

[Status](https://status.superdoc.dev) • [GitHub](https://github.com/superdoc-dev/superdoc)

apiKey.description: API key authentication. Keys start with `sd_`

Error.title: Error Response
Error.description: Standard error response format used across all endpoints

code.description: Machine-readable error code for programmatic handling

message.example: The provided document format is not supported

details.description: Additional error details for validation errors

document.description: DOCX input provided as either base64 or URL

fields.description: Field entries containing id/group, type, value, and optional options

id/group.description: Field identifier. Use `id` to target a single specific field in the template, or use `group` to populate multiple fields with the same group identifier. Only one is required.

value.description: Value to populate the field with. String for text/image/signature fields, array of arrays for table type

options.description:
Optional configuration for field rendering.

**Options by field type:**

| Field Type | Supported Options |
|------------|------------------|
| `text` | `keepTextNodeStyles` |
| `image` | `dimensions` |
| `signature` | `dimensions`, `arcElement`, `topLabel`, `bottomLabel` |
| `table` | `copyRowStyle` |

keepTextNodeStyles.description: For text fields: Whether to keep the existing text node styles when replacing content. Defaults to true.

copyRowStyle.description: For table fields: Copy the style from the template row to populated rows

dimensions.description: For image/signature fields: Specify the dimensions of the rendered element

arcElement.description: For signature fields: Styling for the signature arc element

color.description: Hex color code for the arc

topLabel.description: For signature fields: Styling for the top label

color.description: Hex color code for the top label text

bottomLabel.description: For signature fields: Styling and content for the bottom label

color.description: Hex color code for the bottom label text

text.description: Custom text for the bottom label

eventId.description: Unique identifier for this signing event

document.description: PDF or DOCX input provided as either base64 or URL

auditTrail.description: Array of signing events and user interactions

metadata.description: Optional metadata (IP, user agent, custom fields)

document.description: Signed PDF provided as either base64 or URL

Unauthorized.description: Authentication required or invalid API key

example.message: Authentication required
Rate limit exceeded. Try again in 60 seconds

get.description:
Returns basic API information and quick start guide.

## Response format
- **JSON**: For programmatic access
- **Plain text**: When called with curl/wget (developer-friendly)

example.name: SuperDoc API
example.message: Document processing API for developers

quickstart.authentication: Include your API key in the Authorization header

get.description: Check API availability. No authentication required. Returns 200 when healthy.

post.description:
Convert documents between formats.

## Supported Conversions
- **DOCX → PDF**: Convert Word documents to PDF
- **Markdown → DOCX**: Convert Markdown to Word documents
- **HTML → DOCX**: Convert HTML to Word documents

## Examples
```bash
# Convert DOCX to PDF
curl -X POST "https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/convert?from=docx&to=pdf" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -F "file=@document.docx" \
  -o output.pdf

# Convert Markdown to DOCX
curl -X POST "https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/convert?from=md&to=docx" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -F "file=@document.md" \
  -o output.docx

# Convert HTML to DOCX
curl -X POST "https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/convert?from=html&to=docx" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -F "file=@document.html" \
  -o output.docx
```

## Limitations
- File size: 25MB maximum
- Concurrent requests: 10 per API key

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Target format for conversion. Defaults to PDF for backward compatibility

x-code-samples.label: Browser upload
Python requests
x-code-samples.source:
import requests

with open('document.docx', 'rb') as f:
    response = requests.post(
        'https://api.superdoc.dev/v1/convert?from=docx',
        headers={'Authorization': 'Bearer YOUR_API_KEY'},
        files={'file': f}
    )
    
with open('converted.pdf', 'wb') as pdf:
    pdf.write(response.content)

post.description:
Sign a PDF or DOCX document with a cryptographic signature.

Send a JSON request body with:
- `document`: object containing either `base64` or `url`
- `signer`: object with signer details (name, email, etc.)
- `auditTrail`: array of signing events
- `eventId`: optional unique identifier
- `metadata`: optional metadata (IP, user agent, custom fields)

The response returns the signed PDF as base64.

post.description:
Verify the signature and integrity of a signed PDF.

Send a JSON request body with:
- `document`: object containing either `base64` or `url`

The response includes verification status, signer information, and document metadata.

get.description:
Start here! Register with your email to get a verification code.

## Flow
1. Call this endpoint with your email
2. Check your email for 6-digit code (expires in 15 minutes)
3. Call [/verify](#tag/authentication/get/v1/auth/verify) with email and code to get your API key

## No spam promise
We only send: verification codes, API keys, and critical service updates.

schema.description: Status message
schema.example: Check your email for verification code.

get.description:
Complete registration by submitting your verification code.
        
## Returns
Your API key (also sent to your email for safekeeping)
        
## Security
We don't store keys in plain text - save yours securely.
